zh-cn: 鲍里斯·尼古拉耶维奇·叶利钦

description.zh-cn: 苏联及俄罗斯政治人物，俄罗斯联邦首任总统，在苏联解体中扮演了关键角色。
description.en: A Soviet and Russian politician who served as the first president of the Russian Federation and played a key role in the dissolution of the Soviet Union.

zh-cn: 米哈伊尔·谢尔盖耶维奇·戈尔巴乔夫

description.zh-cn: 苏联最后一任最高领导人，曾任苏联共产党中央委员会总书记和苏联总统。
description.en: The last leader of the Soviet Union, serving as General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union and President of the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯政治人物，接替叶利钦成为俄罗斯总统。
description.en: A Russian politician who succeeded Boris Yeltsin as President of Russia.

description.zh-cn: 一个存在于1922年至1991年的欧亚大陆北部的主权国家。
description.en: A sovereign state that spanned much of Eurasia from 1922 to 1991.

description.zh-cn: 苏联解体后的主要继承国。
description.en: The primary successor state to the Soviet Union after its dissolution.

en: Communist Party of the Soviet Union

description.zh-cn: 苏联的创始及唯一执政党。
description.en: The founding and ruling political party of the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 叶利钦时期推行的一套旨在将俄罗斯经济快速转向资本主义的激进经济政策。
description.en: A set of radical economic policies implemented during Yeltsin's presidency to quickly transition the Russian economy to capitalism.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯联邦的国家元首职位。
description.en: The head of state of the Russian Federation.

nodes.id: 苏联共产党莫斯科委员会第一书记

zh-cn: 苏联共产党莫斯科委员会第一书记
苏共莫斯科市委第一书记
en: First Secretary of the Moscow City Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union

description.zh-cn: 苏联共产党在莫斯科的最高领导职务。
description.en: The highest leadership position of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in Moscow.

nodes.id: 维克托·瓦西里耶维奇·格里申

zh-cn: 维克托·瓦西里耶维奇·格里申

description.zh-cn: 苏联政治人物，叶利钦的前任苏共莫斯科市委第一书记。
description.en: Soviet politician, Yeltsin's predecessor as First Secretary of the Moscow City Committee of the CPSU.

en: State Committee on the State of Emergency

description.zh-cn: 在八一九事件中试图推翻戈尔巴乔夫的一群苏联高级官员。
description.en: A group of senior Soviet officials who attempted to overthrow Mikhail Gorbachev during the August Coup.

description.zh-cn: 由部分前苏联加盟共和国组成的区域性国际组织，旨在取代苏联。
description.en: A regional intergovernmental organization of some post-Soviet republics, created to replace the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 白俄罗斯政治人物，与叶利钦、克拉夫丘克共同签署协议成立独立国家联合体。
description.en: Belarusian politician who, along with Yeltsin and Kravchuk, signed the agreement to form the Commonwealth of Independent States.

description.zh-cn: 乌克兰首任总统，与叶利钦、舒什克维奇共同签署协议成立独立国家联合体。
description.en: The first President of Ukraine who, along with Yeltsin and Shushkevich, signed the agreement to form the Commonwealth of Independent States.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯政治人物，曾任俄罗斯国会议长，在1993年宪政危机中是叶利钦的主要政治对手。
description.en: A Russian politician and former speaker of the Russian parliament who was a key political opponent of Yeltsin during the 1993 constitutional crisis.

description.zh-cn: 俄罗斯政治人物，曾任俄罗斯副总统，在1993年宪政危机中反对叶利钦。
description.en: A Russian politician and former Vice President of Russia who opposed Yeltsin during the 1993 constitutional crisis.

description.zh-cn: 鲍里斯·叶利钦的妻子，俄罗斯前第一夫人。
description.en: Wife of Boris Yeltsin and former First Lady of Russia.

description.zh-cn: 位于叶卡捷琳堡的一所俄罗斯高等教育机构，叶利钦的母校。
description.en: A Russian higher education institution in Yekaterinburg, the alma mater of Boris Yeltsin.

description.zh-cn: 前苏联异议作家和诺贝尔文学奖得主，对叶利钦持批评态度。
description.en: A former Soviet dissident writer and Nobel laureate in Literature, who was critical of Boris Yeltsin.

description.zh-cn: 叶利钦是俄罗斯历史上首位民选国家元首，于1991年当选，并于1996年连任。
description.en: Yeltsin was the first popularly elected head of state in Russian history, elected in 1991 and re-elected in 1996.

description.zh-cn: 1961年加入苏联共产党，1990年7月在苏共二十八大后宣布退党。
description.en: Joined the CPSU in 1961 and announced his withdrawal from the party in July 1990 after the 28th Congress of the CPSU.

description.zh-cn: 戈尔巴乔夫亲自提拔叶利钦接替格里申，成为苏共莫斯科市委第一书记。
description.en: Gorbachev personally promoted Yeltsin to replace Grishin as the First Secretary of the Moscow City Committee of the CPSU.

description.zh-cn: 因叶利钦在政治局会议上严厉批评戈尔巴乔夫的政策，先后被免除莫斯科党委第一书记职务和中央政治局候补委员职务。
description.en: After Yeltsin severely criticized Gorbachev's policies at a Politburo meeting, he was dismissed first as First Secretary of the Moscow Party Committee and then as a candidate member of the Central Politburo.

description.zh-cn: 叶利钦在1991年12月与其他加盟国领导人共同促成了苏联解体。
description.en: In December 1991, Yeltsin, along with leaders of other union republics, facilitated the dissolution of the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 在八一九事件期间，叶利钦公开反对政变，要求军队和民众抵制国家紧急状态委员会。
description.en: During the August Coup, Yeltsin publicly opposed the coup, calling on the military and public to resist the State Committee on the State of Emergency.

description.zh-cn: 八一九事件中，国家紧急状态委员会软禁了在克里米亚度假的苏联总统戈尔巴乔夫。
description.en: During the August Coup, the State Committee on the State of Emergency placed Soviet President Gorbachev, who was on vacation in Crimea, under house arrest.

description.zh-cn: 叶利钦与白俄罗斯的舒什克维奇、乌克兰的克拉夫丘克在明斯克签约，成立独立国家联合体以取代苏联。
description.en: Yeltsin, along with Shushkevich of Belarus and Kravchuk of Ukraine, signed an agreement in Minsk to establish the Commonwealth of Independent States to replace the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 舒什克维奇与俄罗斯的叶利钦、乌克兰的克拉夫丘克在明斯克签约，成立独立国家联合体以取代苏联。
description.en: Shushkevich, along with Yeltsin of Russia and Kravchuk of Ukraine, signed an agreement in Minsk to establish the Commonwealth of Independent States to replace the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 克拉夫丘克与俄罗斯的叶利钦、白俄罗斯的舒什克维奇在明斯克签约，成立独立国家联合体以取代苏联。
description.en: Kravchuk, along with Yeltsin of Russia and Shushkevich of Belarus, signed an agreement in Minsk to establish the Commonwealth of Independent States to replace the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 叶利钦采取“休克疗法”试图让俄罗斯尽快走上资本主义，推行激进的经济改革。
description.en: Yeltsin adopted "shock therapy" in an attempt to quickly move Russia towards capitalism, implementing radical economic reforms.

description.zh-cn: “休克疗法”的实施让俄罗斯经济濒临崩溃，并导致了寡头的崛起。
description.en: The implementation of "shock therapy" brought the Russian economy to the brink of collapse and led to the rise of oligarchs.

description.zh-cn: 叶利钦下令军队包围并进攻议会大厦，以武力解决了与议会的政治对峙。
description.en: Yeltsin ordered the military to surround and attack the parliament building, resolving the political standoff with the parliament by force.

description.zh-cn: 在1993年俄罗斯宪政危机中，叶利钦与时任国会议长的哈斯布拉托夫存在严重政治分歧并最终发生武力冲突，哈斯布拉托夫等人被捕。
description.en: During the 1993 Russian constitutional crisis, Yeltsin had severe political disagreements with then-parliamentary speaker Khasbulatov, which ultimately led to armed conflict and the arrest of Khasbulatov and his supporters.

description.zh-cn: 在1993年俄罗斯宪政危机中，叶利钦与时任副总统的鲁茨科伊存在严重政治分歧，叶利钦下令解除其职务，鲁茨科伊被议会宣布接替总统职务，最终被捕。
description.en: During the 1993 Russian constitutional crisis, Yeltsin had severe political disagreements with then-Vice President Rutskoy. Yeltsin ordered his dismissal, while the parliament declared Rutskoy as acting president, leading to his eventual arrest.

description.zh-cn: 叶利钦遴选普京为政府总理和自己的继承人，并于1999年12月31日辞职，由普京接任临时总统。
description.en: Yeltsin selected Putin as Prime Minister and his successor, and resigned on December 31, 1999, allowing Putin to become acting president.

description.zh-cn: 为应对车臣的分离主义，叶利钦在其任内发动了第一次车臣战争。
description.en: In response to Chechen separatism, Yeltsin launched the First Chechen War during his presidency.

description.zh-cn: 车臣战争的悬而未决，大大地损害了叶利钦在国民心中的地位。
description.en: The unresolved Chechen War significantly damaged Yeltsin's standing among the Russian public.

description.zh-cn: 1950年入读乌拉尔工学院（现乌拉尔国立技术大学）建筑系并于1955年毕业。
description.en: Enrolled in the Faculty of Architecture at the Ural Polytechnic Institute (now Ural State Technical University) in 1950 and graduated in 1955.

description.zh-cn: 索尔仁尼琴在2000年评价称，叶利钦时代摧毁和洗劫了俄罗斯政治、经济、文化和道德生活的所有基础领域。
description.en: In 2000, Solzhenitsyn commented that the Yeltsin era destroyed and plundered all fundamental areas of Russia's political, economic, cultural, and moral life.

description.zh-cn: 中国外交部表示，叶利钦为中俄关系发展作出了突出贡献，中国人民失去了一位挚友。
description.en: The Chinese Foreign Ministry stated that Yeltsin made outstanding contributions to the development of Sino-Russian relations and that the Chinese people lost a dear friend.
